prs.title: ci: Add nolintlint to golangci-lint
prs.truncated_body:
https://golangci-lint.run/usage/linters/#nolintlint

Configuration:
* All `nolint` directives need a reason
* The tool will flag nolints that aren't actually triggered (i.e. it'll flag outdated directives that don't apply anymore). (When a nolint is removed here, this is why.)
* Ensures correct formatting

This PR was created by adding the linter and then running `golangci-lint run --fix`.

prs.title: Node/Solana: Minor watcher cleanup
prs.truncated_body:
This PR does some minor clean up of the Solana watcher. Notably:

- Optimizes the check to see if a transaction might include a wormhole `PostMessage`
- Can't save the `ctx` across a restart since it may have previously been canceled
- Removes logging of the commitment level since it is in the logger name
- Cleans up various other log messages
- A few other minor things
- Don't count the wr

commits.message: Don't count wrong commitment as an observation

Activates the majority of our E2E tests to run on pushes to develop and new tags.

Notice that the tests will run on `push` events to `develop` or to new tags, regardless of what changes have been made.

prs.title: Update docker image type to "manual" for workflow dispatches
prs.truncated_body:
Needs: https://github.com/smartcontractkit/.github/pull/998

When workflow dispatches (manually running a workflow) are ran, the docker image type will be set to "manual" which will give the docker image tag a prefix of "manual-" instead of "sha-" to allow for more accurate retention/lifecycle policies in ECR.

prs.title: Sort imports on pre-commit
prs.truncated_body:
## Description

By sorting imports automatically we can avoid thinking about how to sort them. Similar to automatic formatting.
Sorting all existing files would be a huge change, so sorting imports on pre-commit is a nice compromise.

## Changes

1. `yarn add prettier-plugin-organize-imports`
2. `git add .yarn/cache/prettier-plugin-organize-imports-npm-4.1.0-49b8116ea7-8223af6d42.zip`
3.

prs.title: Check grafting from pre 0.0.6 to 0.0.6 and later
prs.truncated_body:
This PR tries to check the consistency of the POI implementation for grafting of subgraph in case there is a transition from a spec version older than 0.0.6 towards the 0.0.6 or newer. The grafting block has a conversion of the legacy hashing algorithm to the new one, and here we test that this conversion did not change.

On order to keep the POI with the expected values, we need to make sure th

prs.title: chore(devnet-sdk): refactor devnet descriptor recording
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**

This centralizes the logic recording the devnet descriptor in
devnet-sdk.

We introduce a higher-level filesystem interface that enables the easy
manipulation (read/write) of that descriptor, instead of replicating
parts of that same logic in various components.

<!--
Contributions welcome! See https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/.github/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

<!--
A cl

commits.message:
chore(devnet-sdk): refactor devnet descriptor recording

This centralizes the logic recording the devnet descriptor in
devnet-sdk.

We introduce a higher-level filesystem interface that enables the easy
manipulation (read/write) of that descriptor, instead of replicating
parts of that same logic in various components.

prs.title: feat: improve reporter bootstrapping performance and reliability in checkpoint submission [backport]
feat: improve reporter bootstrapping performance and reliability in checkpoint submission
prs.truncated_body:
# Summary
Improves the reporter’s bootstrapping performance by avoiding redundant checkpoint submissions and enabling non-blocking startup.

# Changes
Replaced InsertBTCSpvProof with ReliablySendMsg
→ Skips duplicated or finalized checkpoints using known error types

Wrapped ProcessCheckpoints() in a goroutine
→ Reporter no longer blocks startup
→ Metrics server starts immediately

Adde

prs.title: Changed max timestamp deviation to allow for a bigger one on testnets.
prs.truncated_body:
# What ❔

Changed COMMIT_TIMESTAMP_NOT_OLDER from being a constant in Config.sol to being an immutable in Executor facet.

## Why ❔

This is done mainly as a quality-of-life improvement for testnets, to allow operators commit batches with older timestamps compared to mainnet. This is intended for testnets, where outages may be resolved slower.

## Checklist

<!-- Check your PR fulfills t

commits.message: changed max timestamp deviation to allow for a bigger one on testnets

prs.title: pulse-scheduler: init ethereum contracts, subscriptions, updating prices
prs.truncated_body:
## Summary

Initialize the Pulse Scheduler Ethereum contracts with a base layer of functionality. Follows the structure/boilerplate of the existing Pulse contracts.

## Rationale
Add state, functions, and tests for:
- Subscription management
  - Only manager can CRUD subscriptions
- Pushing and consuming price updates
  - An update to a subscription's feeds must have matching timestamps a

commits.message: feat(scheduler): init scheduler state and core functions
test: add test for mismatched timestamps

feat(scheduler): enhance price update logic and validation

- Updated price feed parsing to allow for a timestamp range of [-10s, now].
- Introduced validation for update conditions, including checks for heartbeat and price deviation.
- Added new error handling for outdated timestamps and unmet update conditions.
- Refactored subscription status to use a uint256 for last updated timestamp.
- Expanded test coverage for update conditions and validation scenarios.
Merge branch 'main' of github.com:pyth-network/pyth-crosschain into tb/pulse-scheduler/init

prs.title: feat(entropy): Add on-chain gas limits and mark out-of-gas failures on-chain
prs.truncated_body:
## Summary

Follow up to the last PR around allowing providers to mark on-chain callbacks as failed. The previous PR covers cases where the contract manually reverts. This PR covers the case where the callback runs out of gas. 

This PR gives each callback a gas limit which is stored in the on-chain struct. Providers can set a default gas limit, or users can manually specify a different gas li

prs.title: Remove Env from extern functions
prs.truncated_body:
### What
Remove Env parameter from invoke_raw_extern function, that is externed for each callable wasm function.

### Why
The extern functions should need to be C-ABI compatibile for a near future version of Rust which is standardizing the wasm32-unknown-unknown build on C-ABI that up until then wasn't actually C-ABI. On nightly-2025-03-27 we can see a warning already appearing, like that docu

commits.message: fix invoke_raw_extern function to not include env that isn't C-ABI

prs.title: Adapt to rust 1.84
prs.truncated_body:
### What

Adapt to rust 1.84.

### Why

Use a version of Rust to build the stellar-cli that supports wasm32v1-none, so that when cargo running the stellar-cli the version of cargo activated also supports building contracts with the new target.

These changes were broken out from #1988.

commits.message: Adapt to rust 1.84 and wasm32v1-none target
remove changes that are not to do with the rust upgrade to ship rust upgrade in a separate commit

chore: update to rust 1.86.0

In theory, this enables the WASM multiple return values proposal. But my
testing with the FVM indicates that everything "just works".

We've explicitly disabled this our compiler settings but... I haven't
observed those options making a difference.

prs.truncated_body:

We've explicitly disabled this our compiler settings but... I haven't observed those options making a difference.

My plan is to merge this because everything does appear to be working correctly and we're not making any progress by sitting around holding our br

commits.message:
chore: update to rust 1.86.0

In theory, this enables the WASM multiple return values proposal. But my
testing with the FVM indicates that everything "just works".

We've explicitly disabled this our compiler settings but... I haven't
observed those options making a difference.

prs.title: Speedup playwright CI
prs.truncated_body:
Before: [5m 47s](https://github.com/oasisprotocol/wallet/actions/runs/14242574836/) (billed time 7m 1s)
Shard: [2m 53s](https://github.com/oasisprotocol/wallet/actions/runs/14318379046/) (billed time 17m 53s)
Build once + container: [2m 54s](https://github.com/oasisprotocol/wallet/actions/runs/14319020422) (billed time 11m 36s)

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/af6be06d-d5e1

commits.message: Move serve-prod into ./playwright (so tests can run without root deps)
Extract runtimeIs out of config (so tests can run without root deps)
Speedup CI: only build once before playwright shards
Speedup CI: use playwright container instead of installing system deps

prs.title: L-04 Use RewardRecipient in claimDelegationFees
prs.truncated_body:
## Why this should be merged

The `claimDelegationFees` function does not take into account the reward recipient that
may have been configured through the `changeValidatorRewardRecipient` function.
Instead, it directly transfers the rewards to the owner of the validator.

This behavior may lead to confusion for validators who expect rewards to be sent to the
designated rewards recipient, as

commits.message: send fees from claimDelegationFees to configured reward address

Update contracts/validator-manager/StakingManager.sol

Co-authored-by: Geoff Stuart <geoff.vball@gmail.com>
Signed-off-by: Ian Suvak <ian.suvak@avalabs.org>

prs.title: N-01-Fix SPDXs License Identifier
prs.truncated_body:
## Why this should be merged
The contract files in scope currently use `SPDX-License-Identifier: Ecosystem` to
indicate that the files are under the custom Ecosystem license. However, this is not a
recognized SPDX license identifier. According to the SPDX specification, custom or non-listed
licenses should be prefixed with `LicenseRef-` to comply with the standard.
Using a non-standard SPDX l

prs.title: N-02 Misleading Documentation
prs.truncated_body:
## Why this should be merged
Throughout the codebase, multiple instances of misleading documentation were identified:

According to [the inline documentation](https://github.com/ava-labs/icm-contracts/blob/8a8f78dcda0b0af60c6fb1762f7927351357d645/contracts/validator-manager/ValidatorManager.sol#L255-L257) in the initializeValidatorSet function, the validationID is calculated by taking the sha25

prs.title: coordinator: fix feature toggle
prs.truncated_body:
This PR implements issue(s) #

### Checklist

* [ ] I wrote new tests for my new core changes.
* [ ] I have successfully ran tests, style checker and build against my new changes locally.
* [ ] I have informed the team of any breaking changes if there are any.

commits.message: added test for max execution time

feat: redesign nonce cache

This redesign uses a proper LRU cache and is more careful about flushing
the cache more efficiently.
chore: small changes from code review

fix: remove the `candidate_cache` during mempool iteration

Now that the db query is taking the nonces into account, it no longer
makes sense to cache these candidate transactions. On the next query,
their nonces should be properly set in the db, so that will get ordered
correctly. This cache would only make performance worse in that case.

test: insert transactions directly into the mempool

This is WAY faster than using the RPC.

feat: improve `NextNonceWithHighestFeeRate` algorithm

When the query runs out of transactions, flush the nonces to the DB and
run the query again until we get no more candidates or we hit some other
exit condition.
added test for max execution time

feat: redesign nonce cache

This redesign uses a proper LRU cache and is more careful about flushing
the cache more efficiently.
chore: small changes from code review

fix: remove the `candidate_cache` during mempool iteration

Now that the db query is taking the nonces into account, it no longer
makes sense to cache these candidate transactions. On the next query,
their nonces should be properly set in the db, so that will get ordered
correctly. This cache would only make performance worse in that case.

test: insert transactions directly into the mempool

This is WAY faster than using the RPC.

feat: improve `NextNonceWithHighestFeeRate` algorithm

When the query runs out of transactions, flush the nonces to the DB and
run the query again until we get no more candidates or we hit some other
exit condition.

prs.title: chore(gitignore): ignore coverage, keys.json, and .idea files
prs.truncated_body:
### Motivation

To make things easier while coding and to prevent commit local test files to be in the version control.

### Acceptance Criteria

- pycharm ide files shouldn't be versioned
- local coverage files shoudn't be versioned
- keys.json

### Checklist

- [ ] If you are requesting a merge into `master`, confirm this code is production-ready and can be included in future release

commits.message: chore(gitignore): ignore coverage, keys.json, and .idea files

We discovered that there is a genesis case where sys files 101 and 102 were empty. This PR fixes the problem by only creating sys files after the node metadata has been synthetically populated.

This PR also removes the deprecated requirement to include 'internal IP address' in gossip endpoints.

Fixes #18551

prs.title: feat: Automatically generate status/request types
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**:
This PR implements the dynamically generation of two core SDK files (`RequestType.js` and `Status.js)` by parsing Hedera protobuf definitions. It creates strongly-typed enums for Hedera functionality types and response status codes, ensuring type safety and maintainability in the SDK.

**Related issue(s)**:
#1145 

**Checklist**

- [X] Documented (Code comments, README, et

commits.message:
feat: Added generateRequestType and command to run it in packages/proto

Signed-off-by: ivaylogarnev-limechain <ivaylo.garnev@limechain.tech>

:efactor: Changed logic only to append  if new Status/RequestTypes are added

refactor: Added comments from proto file to the generated Status/Request files and refactored a bit the code

prs.title: fix: Transaction receipt unhealthy error
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**:
This PR fixes execution of `getReceiptQuery` and `getRecordQuery` that are single-node requests, meaning they rely on one specific node to succeed. If that node is unhealthy, these queries can fail with errors such as "Network connectivity issue: All nodes are unhealthy." To handle this, we retry the request up to 10 times before failing with a delay.

**Related issue(s)**:
#2

commits.message:
fix: Added special case for transaction receipt or record

Signed-off-by: ivaylogarnev-limechain <ivaylo.garnev@limechain.tech>

tests: Added tests for the transaction receipt/record unhealthy case

Signed-off-by: ivaylogarnev-limechain <ivaylo.garnev@limechain.tech>

fix: removed exclusive mocha test

Signed-off-by: ivaylogarnev-limechain <ivaylo.garnev@limechain.tech>

fix: Comments, impoved condition check and the delayForAttemp logic

Signed-off-by: ivaylogarnev-limechain <ivaylo.garnev@limechain.tech>

refactor: Unit test for custom retry timeout period

Signed-off-by: ivaylogarnev-limechain <ivaylo.garnev@limechain.tech>
